qas.question: Who proposed a merger of many colleges in 1907?
What was the reasoning behind the proposal to merge many colleges?

answers.text: greater capacity for higher technical education was needed

qas.question: When the merger was passed, what constituent college was created?

answers.text: The Imperial College of Science and Technology

qas.question: Who did the constituent college belong to?
Which document, granted by Edward VII, was officially signed on the 8th of July 1907?
What was founded in the 19th century?
Who decided that more liberal education was needed?

plausible_answers.text: the City and Guilds College, the Royal School of Mines and the Royal College of Science

qas.question: What schools were formed from the Imperial College of Science?
When was the charter signed for the University of London?
Who granted the Royal Charted for the Unoiversity of London?

context: In 1907, the newly established <a0_0><b5_0><b6_0>Board of Education<b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> found that <a1_0>greater capacity for higher technical education was needed<a1_0/> and a proposal to merge <b7_0>the City and Guilds College, the Royal School of Mines and the Royal College of Science<b7_0/> was approved and passed, creating <a2_0>The Imperial College of Science and Technology<a2_0/> as a constituent college of the <a3_0>University of London<a3_0/>. <a4_0>Imperial's Royal Charter<a4_0/>, granted by <b9_0>Edward VII,<b9_0/> was officially signed on <b8_0>8 July 1907<b8_0/>. The main campus of Imperial College was constructed beside the buildings of the Imperial Institute in South Kensington.
